data.title: Uncaught Error: watch EPERM
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
The error initially occurred while viewing the results of a gradle build _while_ it was being redirected to a file (gradle --stacktrace -d compileTestJava > out.txt 2>&1), but continued after out.txt was closed.   Only the build.gradle and out.txt file were open when there error started. The error seemed to occur after a fixed period of time rather than any user interaction. Another atom error immediately followed this one (Uncaught ReferenceError: item is not defined: C:\Users\agilex01.atom\packages\gradle-ci\node_modules\chokidar\index.js:261) (atom-gradle-ci issue 4)

**Atom Version**: 0.199.0
**System**: Microsoft Windows 7 Professional 
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

Uncaught Error: watch EPERM


data.title: (SOLUTION) Session restore on windows still failing with build 1.99.0 on latest win10 preview
data.body:
Windows 10 insider preview 10074 / Atom 1.99.0

Editor file saved in storage dir is being saved with a long string of hex in the filename (editor-ac42cf437b339099db1a29.......) and not being read by atom on startup.
Each startup makes a new file.

Renaming one file to simply "editor" allows atom to open and restore my previous session.

Hope this helps.

data.title: Error compiling Less stylesheet
data.body:
Hi,
Everytime when I open atom, I get the error:

Error compiling Less stylesheet: /home/victor/.atom/styles.less
Line number: 1
Unrecognised input

I'm using ubuntu and I have other pc with the same config files that the error don't happens.
Someone knows how to help me?

data.title: Change dialog titles for "open project folder" and "open file"
data.body: With there being multiple now and being able to be opened in the same window it would be nice if the dialog titles reflected such so that mistakes in keystrokes can be quickly corrected before they become a problem (in that you browse to a place and can't open a file.)

data.title: [0.199.0] All .js files will not open
data.body: The editor auto-update to 0.199.0 from 0.198.0 and now all files with an `.js` extension will not open properly; sometimes it outright refuse to open while sometimes the file content will load but the corresponding tab will not appear.

data.title: Option to turn off "open last used tabs/folders"
data.body: All of the projects I'm working on are mounted through SSHFS which will become inaccessible as I move around places, and now that Atom attempts to load previously opened tabs/folders on program startup, I almost always will see a huge list of red warnings on the right side twice a day as I move from home to office and office to home. It'd be great if we can add in an option to turn this behavior off because it's not beneficial to me in this case.

data.title: Show function parameter names on autocompletion
data.body:
I don't really know if this issue belongs here, but since I like a lot how WebStorm autocompletes code, I think it would be a great idea to implement a code hint that shows functions parameter names. Here's a gif example showing how WebStorm handles this:

![WebStorm parameter hinting](http://i.imgur.com/ikHBaVB.gif)

This feature helps a lot when I don't know exactly how many arguments a function is supposed to handle.

data.title: Scroll jumping when number of lines from 99 -> 100
data.body:
1. open markdown file with softwrapped lines
2. make newlines so that there are 1-99 on the line numbers
3. scroll down a bit so you arent at scrollTop 0
4. Make one more new line
5. wtf jump
6. remove newline
7. wtf jump back

![bug-newline-scroll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/7644387/f7db9cec-fa58-11e4-9247-b8ae1293e7b5.gif)

I assume this has to do with some gutter re-rendering?

data.title: Atom slow to open + tabs broken (0.199.0 Mac)
data.body:
Atom now seems much slower to open after installing the latest version (0.199.0). There's a definite delay of a few seconds from when the window appears until something is shown (Tree view, panes etc.). Oddly this release claims:

'Opening editors is now significantly faster than previously releases'

**And worse**. Opening a file by clicking on it in the tree view no longer opens the file. The tab for it appears at the top of the window but there's no content shown under it. It still shows the rotating help text you normally see when there's no file open.

data.title: Toggle Find in Buffer with Command-F
data.body:
OS: Mac OS X Yosemite 10.10.3
Atom Version: 0.199.0

Hitting the Command-F keys brings up the Find in Buffer dialog box, which is great. However, whenever I want to close that box, I have to go up to the menu bar and toggle it off that way. Most users are used to being able to toggle search functionality via hitting the same command combination again. It's a little annoying to have to go to the extra step.

![screen shot 2015-05-14 at 4 16 49 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8802128/7644086/d2f4f7ba-fa54-11e4-8272-c39ed008bfb3.png)

data.title: Run package specs from the active item's project folder
data.body: I was editing `find-and-replace` and `atom` in the same window, and it was annoying not being able to run specs for both projects. Now it tries to run the package specs for the active pane item. If there's no active pane item or it doesn't have a path, it uses the first project directory like it did before.

data.title: Alt codes are difficult with multiple files open
data.body:
Pressing <kbd>alt</kbd>+<kbd>1</kbd> through <kbd>alt</kbd>+<kbd>9</kbd> will attempt to switch tabs. [See code here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/44db3e7d2b56cc4ca32b24d47d3964e60ff761ab/keymaps/win32.cson#L80-L88)

When entering an alt code, the tabs switch. It's hard to enter alt codes.

**Workaround:** Open a file in a separate pane, and enter alt codes there.

data.title: When expanding a directory in the navigation tree, if the only child is another directory, expand that as well
data.body:
It'd be awesome if the navigation tree did basically the same thing as github, letting you easily skip through multiple levels of nested trees. (This turns out to be a super common thing with Java code)

Cheers! :heart:

data.title: Atom crashes listing the contents of a directory with a large number of files
data.body:
I'm not sure if it's possible to add in some sort of guard or max-file listing, but clicking expand on a folder with a large number of files and subfolders in it (1000s), renders Atom unresponsive. 

The unresponsiveness persists through a restart, as Atom tries to resume the previous state on load (thus expanding the folder again). I resolved the issue by deleting my `~/.atom/storage` folder, restarting, and resisting the urge to click the folder again.
### Steps to reproduce

I don't know the exact number of files necessary, but here's an example of how to reproduce it:
1. Run [this script](https://github.com/benbalter/gman/blob/master/script/vendor-nl), which will wget a large website, creating a bunch of subdirectories
2. Open the parent folder in Atom
3. After a few moments (you don't need to wait for the script to stop)
4. Click the folder to expand it
## Expected

The folder would load displaying the sub tree, or at least part of it
## Actual

Editor has become unresponsive error

data.title: Avoid saving window state when closing windows after quitting
data.body: Refs #6466

data.title: Uploading using Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP)?
data.body: Is there a way, or does anyone know of an extension beyond SFTP/FTP that will allow me to upload a file to an RDP? I cannot connect to our virtual machine via ftp to upload files, so I have to resort to manually dragging and dropping. This is due to us using bitbucket.

data.title: show-previous-item and next item order error
data.body:
This is my key map :

```
'body':
  'ctrl-,': 'pane:show-next-item'
  'ctrl-.': 'pane:show-previous-item'
```

When I hitting the `ctrl-.` shortcut , Sometimes not to switch to the next file , Seems to be the sort have a problem . Wish fixed it . Thanks all .

data.title: Remove hard coded restrictions to enable more correct indentions
data.body:
Currently these hard coded restrictions prevent some very valid use cases (will add a before and after screencasts at the bottom) and limit the possibilities to implement correct indentation. As far as I’ve tested with it, I did not
find any negative and/or unexpected behaviour with the restrictions removed, but of course I did not test with all possible languages Atom supports.

If it turns out there is a language that does have negative effects from this change, I would argue that the correct place to fix that is in the specific language package by altering the increaseIndentPattern and/or (more likely) the decreaseIndentPattern, instead of relying on these hard coded restrictions.

Before:
![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4171547/7628544/db28e958-fa24-11e4-9599-126bd61ef749.gif)
As you can see here the bracket isn't indented correctly when moving it to the next line. The decreaseIndentPattern is correct as it does increase when removing and typing in the bracket again on the same line.

After:
![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4171547/7628620/df8dfb5e-fa25-11e4-9056-b58b4aee31fa.gif)
After removing the hard coded restrictions, the bracket is indented as expected.

data.title: Add opened files and folders to recently opened list
data.body:
This pull request adds the recent files list to the Atom dock icon's menu on Mac OS.

![screen shot 2015-05-13 at 9 37 23 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/742678/7626165/7d4f455a-f9b8-11e4-90c2-2b3ab95e7f00.png)

Electron's API supposedly also supports Windows, so theoretically this patch should also work on that platform, but I'm not able to test it.

No change will be visible on Linux.

Unfortunately I attempted to add a Clear Recent Documents dock menu item using the Electron API, but I wasn't able to make that work. Maybe someone else has some guidance on that or can implement it themselves.

data.title: Improve performance of opening files
data.body:
Currently, opening large files takes a long time. Most of the time is spent tokenizing the lines and computing the screen lines (accounting for soft-wraps, etc). Because of a small logic error, this was all happening _twice_, every time we opened a file.

These flame graphs are for opening an example 2.3MB javascript file (jQuery 2.0.3, concatenated 10 times).
### Before

Opening the file took about **8.2 seconds**. The span of time between the two red arrows is unnecessary work.

![screen shot 2015-05-13 at 8 18 58 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/326587/7625546/dd157690-f9ad-11e4-8025-481e19c33bc1.png)
### After

No more duplicated work. Opening the file took about **3.2 seconds**.

![screen shot 2015-05-13 at 8 17 45 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/326587/7625548/e51e262a-f9ad-11e4-995f-8c0236b4dce7.png)

data.title: Refactor `state.gutters` in TextEditorPresenter; pass minimal state to gutter components
data.body:
This is the first part in a series of follow-ups to polish off https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5217.

This PR does the following:
- Changes `@state.gutters` in TextEditorPresenter to be an Array of Objects of the form:
  - gutter: Gutter model object
  - visible: boolean, whether the gutter is visible
  - content: either what used to be @state.gutters.lineNumberGutter or @state.gutters.customDecorations[gutterName], depending on the gutter
  - styles: an Object with fields: scrollHeight, scrollTop, backgroundColor
- Changes the `state` that is passed to each gutter component's `::updateSync` to only contain the state that it needs.
